ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The workload of L4 Spanish could be pretty annoying, but chances are you have to take this anyways. My Spanish improved quite a bit over the course of the semester.
Take it if you have to for language requirement.
A good class, no crazy workload.

If you need it for a language requirement, then yes. But if not, then only if you really enjoy learning Spanish or if you are considering Spanish as a major/double major because it really does get to be a lot of work towards the end.

I would recommend SPAN 140 07 to students who want to strengthen grammar, reading, and speaking skills. It is probably not for students who really want to apply their Spanish to more creative and advanced material.
